text:
Trying to install and msi aborts saying:

Internal Error 2735. ResolveServerName

I'm using a free Wireless connection ISP which means that I don't use a 
phoneline dsl etc.

Apache setup seems to want internet access and despite the fact I am online it 
doesn't seem to like my wireless access.

I have also tried apache 1.3: Same problem.

This isn't helpful as installers are supposed to be user friendly and do the 
hard work for the end user. I have no idea how to compile using C (or whatever 
it's written in) and then setup manually.

I simply want to be able to install without msi getting ackward because of my 
connection type.
creator: dale_jamie@zwallet.com

text:
Please try users@httpd.apache.org for Win32 help, no idea if this is some
fixable bug or not.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
You can presume we will not be introducing new support for Win9x (WinME 
  being just a flavor of 98) nor Apache 1.3.

  Further Apache requires DNS to be configured.  You could go by IP address
  instead of server names.  But this is a requirement for ALL platforms,
  no discrimination against Windows.

  Further you can expect Apache to crash when the network config changes, so
  a wireless platform that you are moving around (losing connectivity, etc)
  is useful only as an intermittant test platform.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
